metadata.title: CVE-2017-14032 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
ARM mbed TLS before 1.3.21 and 2.x before 2.1.9, if optional authenticationis configured, allows remote attackers to bypass peer authentication via anX.509 certificate chain with many intermediates. NOTE: although mbed TLSwas formerly known as PolarSSL, the releases shipped with the PolarSSL nameare not affected.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14032` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmbedcrypto0 - 2.2.1-2ubuntu0.2
libmbedtls10 - 2.2.1-2ubuntu0.2
libmbedx509-0 - 2.2.1-2ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mbedtls package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.1-2ubuntu0.2').
